channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows—like "Succession," "Yellowstone" and "Ozark." https://t.co/dib1xmvm8s
Chechen warlord Ramzan Kadyrov’s forces had been a feared fighting force, but Ukraine’s defenders are proving to be a match https://t.co/bCqXNAtSNo

Italian police seized a real-estate complex owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov. The complex of residential buildings, with an estimated value of around €105 million ($116 million), is located in Portisco, the police said. https://t.co/hxPO42Zeo2
Iran set up a clandestine banking system outside the country that handles billions of dollars in banned trade, according to documents and Western officials https://t.co/ns5rU3gu0J
Gambling regulators in two states say they are looking into Barstool and Penn National amid sexual-misconduct accusations against Barstool’s founder https://t.co/zJxa7J2ZXq

President Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping conferred Friday amid growing hostility over Ukraine and what the U.S. says is Beijing’s failure to join other leading nations in denouncing Russia’s military assault on Ukraine https://t.co/wW6i64l68K

President Vladimir Putin addressed tens of thousands of supporters at a Moscow stadium, justifying the invasion of Ukraine he ordered and arguing the operation where Russia is sustaining heavy losses is going to plan https://t.co/QcPmTXIpej
Ivermectin got loads of attention from celebrities like Joe Rogan as a way to treat Covid-19, but a large study has questioned its effectiveness https://t.co/NKuKFZjaJQ
Workers rescued 130 people from a Ukrainian theater that was hit by a Russian airstrike. About 1,300 remained trapped in the basement. https://t.co/wYjaSekAne
The palatial and ornate Manhattan mansions depicted on the hit HBO series ‘The Gilded Age’ once existed, but almost all have been demolished https://t.co/JARnza5dVK
From @WSJopinion: China has picked the wrong horse, and it has shown again in Ukraine, as in Hong Kong, that it can’t be trusted. The West should respond accordingly. https://t.co/pGdTl9bxcE

The House passed legislation to strip Russia and Belarus of their most-favored-nation trade status, which could result in higher import tariffs on some products from those countries #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/S1JXS5Nna2 https://t.co/IRzseaTiQe

Rescue workers have freed 130 people from the destroyed theater in Mariupol, Lyudmyla Denisova, Ukraine’s ombudsman, said Friday, following a Russian airstrike on the building. She declined to confirm any fatalities. https://t.co/4EtZgS7Kb5
Most medical debts will be removed from consumers’ credit reports, easing a burden that makes it harder for millions of Americans to borrow https://t.co/iQmh8wq7eZ
“Nobody wants to leave the city anymore.” People in this Ukrainian port city are attempting a tentative return to normality after Russian forces were pushed back. https://t.co/76Iw3Smk2l
Morgues overflowing. Crematoria working around the clock. A shortage of coffins. Hong Kong struggles through the world’s highest peak death rates from Covid-19 https://t.co/sNwcxDkWjt

Unvaccinated MLB players won’t be allowed to enter Canada to play against the Toronto Blue Jays. The rule will provide a glimpse into how many players have declined to take the shots. https://t.co/trZuP4TBw6

French President Emmanuel Macron said he planned to increase the legal retirement age to 65 from the current 62, raising a controversial issue three weeks before national elections https://t.co/S7puf6MQxV

The president of Restaurant Brands International said his company has demanded the suspension of Burger King restaurant operations in Russia, but that the main operator of its joint venture has refused to do so https://t.co/edwYhrITlW
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/ccw6j5rEoT
From @WSJopinion: The U.S. should revise its strategy to set the stage for negotiating a palatable solution between Russia and Ukraine, writes Zalmay Khalilzad https://t.co/EvhkdF5qDU

Kentucky is still a place for one-and-dones. For years, that meant talented freshmen exiting for the NBA after a single season. In 2022, it means a shocking one-game exit from the NCAA tournament. https://t.co/1xYw6HmqIO

Walmart wants to hire around 50,000 workers in the U.S. in the current quarter, the company said, as the country’s largest private employer pushes to expand its retail and other businesses in the midst of a tight labor market https://t.co/EA9LDHyxOQ
Koch Industries said its subsidiary Guardian Industries will keep operating two glass manufacturing plants in Russia that employ 600 people https://t.co/2i9mCW9OTB

From @WSJopinion: Volodymyr Zelensky’s words and personal courage have stirred the world to action, writes @KarlRove. Whatever fate awaits him and his nation, those who watched him address the joint congressional session won’t soon forget it. https://t.co/FssNeJYOSr

It took about 10 seconds for Russian television producer Marina Ovsyannikova to transform herself from a Kremlin propaganda cog into the most daring dissident opposed to Putin's war. “The future of my country is being decided right now,” she tells WSJ. https://t.co/nypUCnTrRL

President Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping plan to speak in a call scheduled for Friday, as the U.S. works to deter China from deeper involvement with Russia during its invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/ROmzTnWwWk

A U.S. teacher who was in Ukraine caring for his sick partner was killed during a Russian attack on Chernihiv, a city north of Kyiv, according to his sister and a local official https://t.co/JUoWA4ptMO
Russia began the war in Ukraine with the world’s largest tank force but the losses it has suffered reveal its weaknesses on the modern battlefield https://t.co/uIsoFVFAoV
An ominous speech by Russian President Vladimir Putin laid out a wartime regime that will tolerate no dissent, with those having ties to the West in the Kremlin’s sights https://t.co/Rbsbu3gJu3
The House passed legislation to end normal trade ties with Russia, a move backed by Biden that could result in higher tariffs on some imports https://t.co/dBUWF5kGxP
From @WSJopinion: Ukraine is World War 2½, writes @DanHenninger. Virtually all of the world’s democracies have committed to repelling Russia. https://t.co/MozIXcWqHg
Essay: The Russian Orthodox Church helped forge the ideology behind Putin’s war on Ukraine https://t.co/z1rCtfV4F7
In rural Russia, locals back Putin’s decision to send an army to Ukraine. “I support everything that is for victory and for Putin.” https://t.co/OVUtsDWiKz
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/AsQV6ZJm9y https://t.co/A02W6XyPjQ

From @WSJopinion: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has inspired the world with his wartime leadership. The question is whether the U.S., and especially its Commander in Chief, is finally going to meet this historic moment. https://t.co/UWILFxsbK1

The U.N.’s cultural agency will provide personal protective equipment such as bullet-proof vests and helmets to journalists in Ukraine, after several have been killed since Russia’s invasion of the country began https://t.co/9JhxKgqYRQ

With initial bids due on Friday, Roman Abramovich’s Chelsea Football Club has attracted interest from more than 20 different parties, including American investors, a group from Saudi Arabia and a British consortium led by a former Olympic champion https://t.co/Luj5TbErKU

From @WSJopinion: SEC Chairman Gary Gensler wants to impose costly new regulations that further discourage companies from going public, and then “level the playing field” by punishing companies that stay private https://t.co/uVct5K05TT

Russia spent heavily to revamp its military. It has floundered in Ukraine, its first major test. “They have never had to operate these complex systems in this kind of conflict since at least the end of the Cold War.” https://t.co/8mNSmQKoQ2
Ukraine’s international crowdfunding effort to support its army has raised more than $400 million for troops and for humanitarian aid so far https://t.co/V0ciM26cLv
Odessa-based programmer Wang Jixian challenges Chinese fans of Vladimir Putin to put words into action on the battlefield, attracting millions of views https://t.co/WmZsnOWnM8
A New Zealand couple hoped the 17-pound tuber they found in their garden would break the Guinness Record for a giant potato. DNA testing showed it wasn’t even a potato. https://t.co/cr1WB8pM3x
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/6pZYgfXhKS https://t.co/dN0zxCtSgh

Satellite images of Ukraine show some of the destruction caused by fighting Wednesday, as Ukraine's military launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in Kyiv and other key cities https://t.co/TVEvr26hPH
NASA shared an image showing a distant star backed by galaxies, saying the James Webb telescope is performing as well as if not better than their most optimistic prediction https://t.co/io9L3bPPdd

Former CNN anchor Chris Cuomo is seeking at least $125 million from his old employer, claiming the network wrongfully terminated him and smeared his journalistic integrity in the process https://t.co/P3JQq43b47

In the two-day battle of Voznesensk, the military and local volunteers repelled much-better-armed Russian forces, who fled leaving behind tanks, rocket launchers and dead soldiers. “The Russians didn’t expect us to be so strong.” https://t.co/VdU7caoEqg
Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the British national who was imprisoned in Iran in 2016, left the country on Wednesday https://t.co/USgyV3MYSL

A Chinese spy hired a private investigator to use violence if necessary to end a candidate’s run for U.S. Congress, instructing him to “beat him until he cannot run for election,” prosecutors alleged as they unsealed a series of complaints https://t.co/HqOQuzycaz
